refnamediv.refpurpose: An object to put application information into the panel.

refentry.refsect1: Stability Level Unstable, unless otherwise indicated

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Properties
refsect1.synopsis: "attention-icon-name" gchar* : Read / Write "category" gchar* : Read / Write / Construct Only "connected" gboolean : Read "icon-name" gchar* : Read / Write "icon-theme-path" gchar* : Read / Write / Construct Only "id" gchar* : Read / Write / Construct Only "menu" DBusGObjectPath* : Read "status" gchar* : Read / Write

refsect1.title: Signals
refsect1.synopsis: "connection-changed" : Run Last "new-attention-icon" : Run Last "new-icon" : Run Last "new-status" : Run Last

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: An application indicator is a way for an application to put a menu into the panel on the user's screen. This allows the user to interact with the application even though it might not be visible to the user at the time. In most cases this is not a good solution as there are other ways to inform the user. It should only be use if persistence is a desired feature for the user (not for your marketing purpose of having your logo in the panel).

refsect2.title: APP_INDICATOR_TYPE
refsect2.para: Get the GType for a AppIndicator.

refsect2.title: APP_INDICATOR()
refsect2.para: Safely convert a GObject into an AppIndicator.

refsect2.title: APP_INDICATOR_CLASS()
refsect2.para: Safely convert a GObjectClass into a AppIndicatorClass.

refsect2.title: IS_APP_INDICATOR()
refsect2.para: Checks to see if obj is in the object hierarchy of AppIndicator.

refsect2.title: IS_APP_INDICATOR_CLASS()
refsect2.para: Checks to see if klass is in the object class hierarchy of AppIndicatorClass.

refsect2.title: APP_INDICATOR_GET_CLASS()
refsect2.para: Gets a pointer to the AppIndicatorClass for the object obj.

listitem.simpara: A GObject in the class hierarchy of AppIndicator.

refsect2.title: APP_INDICATOR_SIGNAL_NEW_ICON
refsect2.para: String identifier for the "new-icon" signal.

refsect2.title: APP_INDICATOR_SIGNAL_NEW_ATTENTION_ICON
refsect2.para: String identifier for the "new-attention-icon" signal.

refsect2.title: APP_INDICATOR_SIGNAL_NEW_STATUS
refsect2.para: String identifier for the "new-status" signal.

refsect2.title: APP_INDICATOR_SIGNAL_CONNECTION_CHANGED
refsect2.para: String identifier for the "connection-changed" signal.

refsect2.title: enum AppIndicatorCategory
refsect2.programlisting: typedef enum { /*< prefix=APP_INDICATOR_CATEGORY >*/ APP_INDICATOR_CATEGORY_APPLICATION_STATUS, /*< nick=ApplicationStatus >*/ APP_INDICATOR_CATEGORY_COMMUNICATIONS, /*< nick=Communications >*/ APP_INDICATOR_CATEGORY_SYSTEM_SERVICES, /*< nick=SystemServices >*/ APP_INDICATOR_CATEGORY_HARDWARE, /*< nick=Hardware >*/ APP_INDICATOR_CATEGORY_OTHER /*< nick=Other >*/ } AppIndicatorCategory;
refsect2.para: The category provides grouping for the indicators so that users can find indicators that are similar together.

listitem.simpara: The indicator is used to display the status of the application.
The application is used for communication with other people.
A system indicator relating to something in the user's system.
An indicator relating to the user's hardware.
Something not defined in this enum, please don't use unless you really need it.

refsect2.title: enum AppIndicatorStatus
refsect2.para: These are the states that the indicator can be on in the user's panel. The indicator by default starts in the state APP_INDICATOR_STATUS_PASSIVE and can be shown by setting it to APP_INDICATOR_STATUS_ACTIVE.

listitem.simpara: The indicator should not be shown to the user.
The indicator should be shown in it's default state.
The indicator should show it's attention icon.

refsect2.title: AppIndicatorPrivate
refsect2.para: All of the private data in an instance of a application indicator.

refsect2.title: AppIndicator
refsect2.para: A application indicator represents the values that are needed to show a unique status in the panel for an application. In general, applications should try to fit in the other indicators that are available on the panel before using this. But, sometimes it is necissary.

refsect2.title: AppIndicatorClass
refsect2.para: The signals and external functions that make up the AppIndicator class object.

listitem.simpara: Function that gets called to make a GtkStatusIcon when there is no Application Indicator area available.
The function that gets called if an Application Indicator area appears after the fallback has been created.

refsect2.title: app_indicator_get_type ()
refsect2.para: Generates or returns the unique GType for AppIndicator.

listitem.simpara: A unique GType for AppIndicator objects.

refsect2.title: app_indicator_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new AppIndicator setting the properties: "id" with id, "category" with category and "icon-name" with icon_name.

listitem.simpara: The unique id of the indicator to create.
The icon name for this indicator
A pointer to a new AppIndicator object.

refsect2.title: app_indicator_new_with_path ()
refsect2.programlisting: AppIndicator * app_indicator_new_with_path (const gchar *id, const gchar *icon_name, AppIndicatorCategory category, const gchar *icon_path);
refsect2.para: Creates a new AppIndicator setting the properties: "id" with id, "category" with category, "icon-name" with icon_name and "icon-theme-path" with icon_path.

listitem.simpara: The unique id of the indicator to create.
The icon name for this indicator
A custom path for finding icons.
A pointer to a new AppIndicator object.

refsect2.title: app_indicator_set_status ()
refsect2.para: Wrapper function for property "status".

listitem.simpara: The status to set for this indicator

refsect2.title: app_indicator_set_attention_icon ()
refsect2.para: Wrapper function for property "attention-icon-name".

listitem.simpara: The name of the attention icon to set for this indicator

refsect2.title: app_indicator_set_menu ()
refsect2.para:
Sets the menu that should be shown when the Application Indicator is clicked on in the panel. An application indicator will not be rendered unless it has a menu.
Wrapper function for property "menu".

refsect2.title: app_indicator_set_icon ()
refsect2.para: Sets the default icon to use when the status is active but not set to attention. In most cases, this should be the application icon for the program. Wrapper function for property "icon-name".

refsect2.title: app_indicator_get_id ()
refsect2.para: Wrapper function for property "id".

refsect2.title: app_indicator_get_category ()
refsect2.para: Wrapper function for property "category".

refsect2.title: app_indicator_get_status ()
refsect2.para: Wrapper function for property "status".

refsect2.title: app_indicator_get_icon ()
refsect2.para: Wrapper function for property "icon-name".

refsect2.title: app_indicator_get_attention_icon ()
refsect2.para: Wrapper function for property "attention-icon-name".

refsect2.title: app_indicator_get_menu ()
refsect2.para: Gets the menu being used for this application indicator. Wrapper function for property "menu".

listitem.simpara: A GtkMenu object or NULL if one hasn't been set.

refsect2.title: The "attention-icon-name" property
refsect2.para: If the indicator sets it's status to APP_INDICATOR_STATUS_ATTENTION then this icon is shown.
Default value: NULL

refsect2.title: The "category" property
refsect2.para: The type of indicator that this represents. Please don't use 'Other'. Defaults to 'ApplicationStatus'.
Default value: NULL

refsect2.title: The "connected" property
refsect2.para: Pretty simple, TRUE if we have a reasonable expectation of being displayed through this object. You should hide your TrayIcon if so.
Default value: FALSE

refsect2.title: The "icon-name" property
refsect2.para: The name of the regular icon that is shown for the indicator.
Default value: NULL

refsect2.title: The "icon-theme-path" property
refsect2.para: An additional place to look for icon names that may be installed by the application.
Default value: NULL

refsect2.title: The "id" property
refsect2.para: The ID for this indicator, which should be unique, but used consistently by this program and its indicator.
Default value: NULL

refsect2.title: The "menu" property
refsect2.para: A method for getting the menu path as a string for DBus.

refsect2.title: The "status" property
refsect2.para: Whether the indicator is shown or requests attention. Defaults to 'Passive'.
Default value: NULL

refsect2.title: The "connection-changed" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (AppIndicator *arg0, gboolean arg1, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: Signaled when we connect to a watcher, or when it drops away.

listitem.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "new-attention-icon" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (AppIndicator *arg0, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: Emitted when "attention-icon-name" is changed

listitem.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "new-icon" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (AppIndicator *arg0, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: Emitted when "icon-name" is changed

listitem.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "new-status" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (AppIndicator *arg0, gchar *arg1, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: Emitted when "status" is changed

listitem.simpara: The string value of the AppIndicatorStatus enum.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
